summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center Legal Department, providing the password for a drive and CD containing discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, signing on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Materials Password Provided
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits the password for a drive and CD containing discovery materials in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell to the detention center's legal department.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is official correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for secured discovery materials (on a drive and CD) pertinent to Maxwell's case.
The letter is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center, where Maxwell was likely held.
Audrey Strauss was the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
The document demonstrates the procedural handling of sensitive discovery materials in a high-profile federal case.
